availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Sandford Duncan Jr. (Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, merchant. Logan County, Kentucky, native. Married to Mary Susan Webb Duncan in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on December 16, 1845. Father of Gideon W. Duncan, Mary Sandford Duncan, and Malcolm Duncan. Merchant in Caldwell County in 1850. Employed Ebenezer Dickey as a merchant's clerk in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Merchant in Jefferson County in 1860. Merchant in partnership with Thomas J. Duncan, at Sandford Duncan & Co., in Louisville in 1861. Gentleman in Jefferson County in 1863.
